tips: 1 lb. of dry pasta will yield approximately 2 Â¼ to 2 Â½ lbs. of cooked pasta

method:
1. Place Ingredients 1 in a bowl. Sprinkle with Ingredients 2 and mix well.
  2. In a separate bowl mix ingredients 3 and add to the cabbage mixture. Mix well.
  3. Cover and place in the refrigerator for 3 -- 4 hours in order for flavours to blend.
tips: None

method:
Preheat the oven to 325f and place the rack in the lower middle position.

  1. Pat the beef dry with paper towels and season with the salt and pepper.
  2. Place the oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy bottomed, oven proof saucepan and over medium high heat, heat until the oil is hot and shimmering. Add the meat in batches and turning frequently sear on all sides. Let the meat obtain a nice brown crust. Transfer each batch of meat to a large bowl and set aside.
  3. To the same pan add the onions, garlic and vinegar and cook for about 5 minutes scraping the brown bits from the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon. Add the tomato paste and cook for about 1 minute. Add the beef with any accumulated juices and sprinkle with the flour. Mix well until the flour has been incorporated. Add the beef broth, water, bay leaf, thyme and sugar. Stirring, bring to a boil. Remove from the heat, cover the pan and place in the preheated oven and cook for about 2 hours.
  4. Remove the pan from the oven and add the carrots and potatoes. Cover and place back in the oven and cook for about an hour or until the vegetables are cooked, the broth has thickened and the meat is tender. Adjust the seasoning if necessary. Serve warm or, cool and place in the refrigerator overnight. The stew improves in flavour if made 1 day ahead of service. To reheat, place covered into a 350f oven or, heat over medium heat. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley when serving.
tips: The stew can be frozen for up to 3 months, just omit the potatoes as they don't freeze well. Defrost for 24 hours in fridge and reheat in oven or over medium low heat until hot. Cook potatoes separately and add them to the stew or serve them on the side.

name_en: Brown Lentils with Garlic and Onions
method:
1. Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed saucepan over medium heat. When hot add the cumin. Stir and add the onions and cook together until the onions are softened.
  2. Add the garlic and continue cooking for a few minutes (be careful not to brown the garlic)
  3. Add the lentils and stir to coat with the oil.
  4. Add the water. Bring to a boil and lower heat. Add the salt and cayenne pepper and simmer for about 45 minutes to 1 hour until the lentils are softened but still retain some firmness.
  5. Taste for seasoning and adjust if necessary.
tips: Serve over plain boiled rice.

method:
1. Cook pasta to "al dente" following package directions. Drain and rinse well in cold water. Drain well.
  2. When pasta has drained, place in a large bowl and add all of the other ingredients. Add the dressing a little at a time and mix after each addition until desired coating is reached. Let sit refrigerated for about 30 -- 45 minutes before serving to allow flavours to blend.

Garnish with fresh basil leaves.
tips: None

ingredients.name: Roasted Red Pepper and Sundried Tomato Dressing

method:
1. Place water and milk In a heavy bottomed saucepan and over medium heat bring to a boil.
  2. Sprinkle in the cornmeal, whisking or stirring constantly. Over medium to low heat cook for about 30 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent burning. Remove from heat.
  3. Stir in the butter and salt and pepper until thoroughly mixed in. Serve immediately.
tips: A true test for "doneness" of polenta -- if a wooden spoon remains upright in the mixture, it's ready!

method:
1. Drain and rinse the chickpeas. Add the chickpeas to a food processor or blender along with the onion, parsley, cilantro, salt, cayenne pepper, garlic and cumin. Blend or process, scraping down as needed, until a thick chunky paste forms. Do not overmix, the blend should still have some texture.
  2. Place the mixture into a bowl and stir in the baking powder. Add flour, 2 tbsp at a time until the mix becomes thick enough to form patties. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavours to blend.
  3. Remove from fridge and, using 2 tbsp amounts, form the falafel mix into small flat patties.
  4. Heat the oil in a thick bottomed frying pan or cast iron skillet until hot. Cook the patties on both sides until a deep golden brown and crisp on the outside.
tips: If preparing falafels for freezing, place formed patties in a single layer on a parchment paper lined baking sheet and when frozen, placed in an airtight container for future use. If making for a gluten-free diet, substitute besan flour for the all-purpose flour and corn tortilla for the pita bread.

method:
1. Mix together all of the filling ingredients until a small crumbly texture is reached. Set aside.
  2. Peel the apples and remove the cores. Cut into pieces about Â½" thick. Place the apples in a bowl and sprinkle with the flour, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and lemon juice. Mix well. Set aside for a few minutes and then spread evenly in a 1.5 litre baking dish. Sprinkle the topping over the apples and dot the top with butter.
  3. Bake for approximately 40 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the apple filling is bubbling up the sides of the baking dish. Cool slightly and serve warm, topped with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.
tips: You can substitute apples with pears, peaches or any fruit that you prefer.

method:
1. In a bowl, combine the eggs, white and brown sugar, butter, oats, milk and vanilla and pour into the unbaked pie shell.
  2. Bake for 55 -- 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the pie comes out clean
tips: Serve warm, topped with vanilla ice cream

method:
1. Place the lentils in water. Bring to the boil. Lower heat and simmer for about 25 minutes until softened. Drain.
  2. Meanwhile, soak the Bulgur in boiling water for 2 minutes and drain
  3. Add the lentils to the Bulgur and mix to combine.
  4. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well.
  5. Adjust salt and pepper to taste and allow to cool. Cover. Allow to sit for about 45 minutes before serving to allow flavours to blend.
tips: This dish is best served at room temperature. Try adding a 19 oz. / 540ml can of chickpeas that have been rinsed and drained at stage 4

method:
1. In a bowl, mix together the soya sauce, brown sugar and garlic powder.
  2. Add the oil to a skillet, heavy bottomed frying pan or wok and heat over medium hot heat.
  3. When the oil is hot add the frozen vegetables and, stirring constantly, fry until vegetables are softened and show a few light brown spots.
  4. Fold and mix in the soya sauce mixture. Serve immediately.
tips: Try adding 2 tsp of peanut butter to the soya sauce mixture.

method:
1. In a large saucepan that has a well-fitting lid, add the oil and heat over medium heat. Add the onions, carrots and celery. Cook, stirring occasionally until the vegetables are *just tender. Add the rice and, stirring, coat the rice with the oil.
  2. Add salt and pepper. Be careful not to add too much salt. Taste the broth and if salty, reduce the amount of added salt as the rice will absorb the salt.
  3. Add the broth to the rice. Most long grain rice requires about 1 Â½ - 2 cups of liquid to every cup of rice. Stir while adding the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to very low, cover the saucepan and cook for approximately 20 - 25 minutes until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed. Do not uncover the saucepan while the rice is cooking.
  4. After cooking, remove from the heat and set aside, covered, for 10 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork and stir in the chopped parsley.
tips: Try adding cooked green peas to the rice for an interesting variation; Just Tender: The vegetables maintain a little firmness.

method:
1. In a bowl, beat the egg lightly and add the melted margarine and milk. Stir well.
  2. In another bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Add the egg mixture and stir until just blended.
  3. Fold in the apples and 1 cup of the cheese.
  4. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin. Sprinkle with the remaining Â¼ cup of cheese and bake in pre-heated oven for approximately 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the centre of the muffin comes out clean and the cheese has turned to golden brown. Remove from the oven and let sit in the muffin tin for 10 minutes. Remove and place on rack to cool
tips: Serve with breakfast, as a snack or in a school lunch

method:
1. In a bowl, beat together the eggs, milk and oil.
  2. In another bowl, mix together the flour, salt, baking powder and sugar. Add to the egg, milk mixture and mix together. Do not overmix.
  3. Add corn and fold in.
  4. If using a deep fryer, heat to 350f and drop in Â¼ cup measures of batter. Cook until golden brown. Check that the fritter is cooked through and remove to a paper towel lined plate to drain.
  5. If using a saucepan, use a thermometer to determine temperature. Remove saucepan from heat immediately after all fritters are cooked.
tips: If fritters are not fully cooked or will be over browned if left in fryer, finish cooking on a baking sheet in a 325f oven

method:
1. Place all of the ingredients in a bowl and mix together until thoroughly mixed. Cover and store in refrigerator for use.
  2. Place all ingredients in a bowl and mix together until thoroughly mixed. Cover and store in refrigerator for use.
tips: Add 1 Tbsp. / 15ml of finely chopped capers to Recipe 2.
